title: IMAP - Disk space is not released when I uncheck "keep for offline usage"
content:
Hello everyone, I've a question about (local) disk space for IMAP accounts. I have an IMAP account; at the beginning I've checked in "Synchronization & Storage" the flag "Keep messages in all folders for this account on this computer". After a while, after I had received many emails, I've unchecked this; I was expecting the disk space occupied by the account to be released, but it didn't happen. I've also checked in the "Advanced" button, just below the flag "Keep messages in all folders for this account on this computer", that every single folder is NOT checked for offline use.

How can I recover my disk space without losing any email?

Thanks in advance
creator: gplus4096

title: No photo in signature on thunderbird on MAC
content:
Hello I switched from windows to MAC during sommer. I integrated Thundebird All worked fine, until yesterday, when I needed to change the html signature by one email account. - I went to the folder with the linked html file - opened the file in word - changed the text on signature - saved

When I create a new email message, the signature appears as: - correct text (after the change I made) - the frame of the desired photo, but not the photo, only descripiton text instead

I tried to do that with completely new folder and new html file and photo, same result.

I guess, the url to the image is obviously correct, because when I link to html with signature and photo of logo and me - face in suit, the result is correct text and the frame in the correct size, the description text "a person in suit), and when I link to html where is no face, just a logo, then again same result, correct text, correcxt size of the photo, but only description: The content of the picture is: alhpabet, row, design - "the description has been created autoamtically".

Does anybody know what to do with it please?

Thank You
creator: JHH1977

title: Alfiókok
content: A postafiókomon (icloud) belül létrehoztam további alfiókokat,. Beállítva s zűrőket, a beérkező leveleket a megadott szabály szerint szétosztja, vagyis áthelyezi a megjelölt alfiókba. Sajnos a Thunderbird alatt ezek az alfiókok nem jelennek meg. Csak a beérkezett üzenet mappa látható (valamint a kuka, a piszkozat, stb) de a többi már nem, így az oda áthelyezett leveleket nem is tudom olvasni. Kérdésem: milyen beállítást kellene használnom, hogy láthatóak legyenek az almappák. Köszönettel, Fefe
creator: zfgrg5hwym

creator: jim487

title: Cannot open .docx attachments with Libre Office
content:
Sorry, not finding anything about this issue, and I honestly don't know if the issue is Settings, or Upgrade &c. Here's the thing:

Recent upgrade to Ubuntu 24.04. Snap version of Thunderbird (very problematic migration). It's working now, but because data was lost, and settings all re-set to zero with the Snap edition, there's been quite a bit of re-customizing &c. Here's the latest:

Someone sends me an e-mail with a .docx attachment, a daily occurence. Try to open it with Libre Office, as I have been doing for twenty years, including Open Office. But Libre Office does not show up as a helper app. Can't be selected from the right click menu. Or .. . ? Maybe I'm missing something, some new way of doing the same old thing.

When I go into settings and navigate down to Files and Attachments, I'm expecting a list of applications, and attendant actions. However, there's only a single line, for .pdf attachments. I don't see any button or facility enabling the user to add an application, and specify what happen when, for instance, you click on a .docx attachment.

And yes, Libre Office *is* installed, I've been using it regularly.
creator: rolf_m
